required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MyopiaX Treatment for the Reduction of Myopia Progression in Children and Adolescents: Safety and Efficacy Investigation
clinical_study.official_title: MyopiaX Treatment for the Reduction of Myopia Progression in Children and Adolescents: Safety and Efficacy Investigation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this trial is to investigate the safety and efficacy of MyopiaX - a digital treatment intended to slow the progression of myopia in children and adolescent.

detailed_description.textblock:
The present study is a multicentric, randomized controlled, double masked trial to investigate the safety and efficacy of MyopiaX, a digital treatment to slow myopia progression as compared to a sham treatment.
The trial consists of a 24 month active treatment period followed by a 12 month- treatment free follow-up. 234 children and adolescent aged 6 - 14 years will be included in the trial. Eligible subjects will be randomly assigned in a 2:1 distribution to either the treatment or the sham group.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Change in spherical equivalent refraction (D) from baseline to 24 months as measured by cycloplegic autorefraction.

secondary_outcome.description: Change in axial length (mm) from baseline to 24 months as measured by optical biometry
Change in spherical equivalent refraction (D) from baseline to 12 months as measured by cycloplegic autorefraction
Changes in axial length (mm) from baseline to 6, 12, and18 months as measured by optical biometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Parent reported outcome - satisfaction with MyopiaX
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire created to evaluate parents satisfaction with the device and treatment concept

arm_group.description: Sham comparator using the same device and components but without the actual treatment

intervention.description: Sham device usage twice a day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Myopic children (-0.75 to -5.0 D SER, least myopic meridian -0.50 D in each eye)
- At least BCVA 0.2 LogMAR in each eye
- Age: 6 - 14 years old
- Evidence of myopia progression over the preceding year (≤ -0.25 D /year at least)
- Good tolerability of test session with VR system
- Binocular adequacy as tested with VR
- Ability to understand treatment and give valid assent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concomitant or previous therapies for myopia
- Eye diseases/conditions:
- Anisometropia ≥ 1.5 D
- Astigmatism ≥ 3 D
- Ophthalmological comorbidities
- Optic nerve abnormalities
- Suspicion of syndromic or monogenetic myopia
- Systemic illnesses affecting eye health, eye growth, and/or refraction
- Any illnesses affecting dopamine function (e.g., sleep disorder)
- Medication affecting dopamine function, accommodation, pupil size, or having an impact on the ocular surface (such as allergy medications)
- Participation in other clinical studies
- Medical history (or family history) of photosensitive epilepsy

overall_official.affiliation: Centre for Eye Reserach Ireland, Technological University Dublin
